GIS Services and Spatial Data Resources - NYU Libraries                               This is the "GIS Services and Spatial Data Resources" guide.      Alternate Page for Screenreader Users      Skip to Page Content                                             GIS Services and Spatial Data Resources         Last update: Mar 2, 2015        URL: http://guides.nyu.edu/content_mobile.php?pid=169769                                                                          GIS Services                                                                                  General Information                         Location   Bobst Library 5th Floor, Research Commons 70 Washington Square South New York, NY 10012        Staffed Hours (Spring 2015)                 Mondays:   12pm - 8pm       Tuesdays:   12pm - 6pm       Wednesdays:   12pm - 8pm       Thursdays:   12pm - 6pm       Fridays:   12pm - 6pm           Data Services workstations are available for walk-in use whenever the library stacks are open .          Contact Us     Get help via our Request Form    Email us: data.services@nyu.edu    Call: (212) 998-3434                                             GIS Day 2014                                                                         close                                                                                                          Learn GIS                                                                                  General Information                         Location   Bobst Library 5th Floor, Research Commons 70 Washington Square South New York, NY 10012        Staffed Hours (Spring 2015)                 Mondays:   12pm - 8pm       Tuesdays:   12pm - 6pm       Wednesdays:   12pm - 8pm       Thursdays:   12pm - 6pm       Fridays:   12pm - 6pm           Data Services workstations are available for walk-in use whenever the library stacks are open .          Contact Us     Get help via our Request Form    Email us: data.services@nyu.edu    Call: (212) 998-3434                                             Learn GIS                      NYU Data Services  provides a number of introductory tutorials and training resources for learning GIS, conducting spatial analysis, geocoding, GoogleEarth, and locating and accessing spatial data through NYU's Spatial Data Repository.  Currently offered GIS tutorials are listed below. To request specialized or customized tutorial, please fill out the request form . A calendar of Data Services' scheduled classes can be found below.        Introduction to ArcGIS       Introduction to Google Earth       Introduction to Google Fusion Tables       Introduction to Geocoding           Click Here to access Class Materials for the Tutorials      In addition, Data Servcies also gives you access a full range of online GIS training offered by ESRI for students, faculty and staff interested in exploring GIS technology, concepts, and applications.      ESRI's Virtual Campus course (self-learning)                                                     Tutorials/Class Materials                      Data Services provide a variety of introductory tutorials in GIS and training resources for learning GIS, conducting spatial analysis, geocoding, GoogleEarth, and locating and accessing spatial data through NYU's Spatial Data Repository.        Introduction to ArcGIS: Tutorial Slides | Tutorial Documentation | Access to SDR       Introduction to Google Earth: Tutorial Resources       Introduction to Google Fusion Tables: Tutorial Documentation        Introduction to Geocoding: Tutorial Slides | Sample data               Comments (0)                                         ESRI's Virtual Campus courses (self-learning):                      ESRI Training Resources       Virtual Campus Web Courses :  are a collection of intensive interactive training courses covering everything from the basics of making maps to advanced applications of spatial analysis. These courses include conceptual material and presentations, hands-on software exercises, and an exams. Courses with a recorded presentation require a broadband connection. Access to the appropriate ArcGIS software is required to complete course exercises.       NYU students, faculty and staff can get limited access to any ESRI's Virtual Campus course at free of cost. Please email Data Services at data.services@nyu.edu with the name(s) of any course(s) in order to receive the necessary access codes and instructions to start Virtual Campus Training.               Virtual Campus Training Seminars :  are free one-hour recorded presentations that include software demonstrations and question and answer sessions with ESRI's subject matter experts. These seminars require broadband connection. These seminars do not require code/s from Data Services.           Instructional Series Podcasts :  are free, short audio recordings on a specific topic delivered by an ESRI's subject matter experts. Listen online or download to an MP3 player. These podcasts do not require code/s from Data Services.              Comments (0)                                         Data Services Classes                      A calendar of Data Services and HPC scheduled classes can be found below. The classes are posted on a monthly basis.   Please note that our classes are intended primarily for members of the NYU community; registrants will need to have  access to the NYU Libraries  to attend.   Click on a class to register     Can't find what you're looking for? Browse our full list of classes offered or contact us for assistance.                                               Feedback forms                          I ntroduction to ArcGIS             Him |     Andrew  |    Michelle |     Rosa |     Sara |      Erin                                 Introduction to Geocoding   Him |    Andrew |   Michelle |   Rosa |   Sara                                  Introduction to Google Earth    Him |     Andrew  |    Michelle |    Rosa |    Sara                                    Introduction to Google Fusion Tables    Him |    Andrew  |    Michelle |    Rosa |    Sara                          Comments (0)                                              close                                                                                                          GIS Software                                                                                  General Information                         Location   Bobst Library 5th Floor, Research Commons 70 Washington Square South New York, NY 10012        Staffed Hours (Spring 2015)                 Mondays:   12pm - 8pm       Tuesdays:   12pm - 6pm       Wednesdays:   12pm - 8pm       Thursdays:   12pm - 6pm       Fridays:   12pm - 6pm           Data Services workstations are available for walk-in use whenever the library stacks are open .          Contact Us     Get help via our Request Form    Email us: data.services@nyu.edu    Call: (212) 998-3434                                             GIS software                      NYU Data Services  supports an array of GIS software as well as othe r  research software packages .       Licensed and freely available GIS software:        ·    ESRI's ArcGIS Desktop     ·    Google Earth     ·    Google Earth Pro (NOW available* in the Data Services Lab)     ·    ERDAS Imagine (NOW available** in the Data Services Lab)    ·    SketchUp     ·     Social Explorer     ·    Geolytics     ·    Other GIS software            ESRI ( Environmental Systems Research Institute )         ArcGIS Desktop  : ArcGIS is a windows-based collection of geographic information systems (GIS) software products designed to produce detailed maps, build spatial models and manage spatial data.       ·    ArcGIS for Desktop Advanced (formerly known as ArcInfo) is the most complete desktop GIS. It includes all the functionality of ArcEditor and ArcView and adds advanced spatial analysis, extensive data manipulation, and high-end cartography tools.    ·    ArcGIS for Desktop Standard (formerly known as ArcEditor) is a powerful GIS desktop system for editing and managing geographic data. It includes all the functionality of ArcView along with additional advanced editing tools to ensure the quality of your data.    ·    ArcGIS for Desktop Basic (formerly known as ArcView) is the basic GIS desktop system for visualizing, managing, creating, and analyzing geographic data.    ·    Extensions   products let you add more capabilities to ArcGIS for Desktop. These specialized tools allow you to perform extended tasks such as raster geoprocessing, three-dimensional analysis, and map publishing. Read more about ArcGIS for Desktop extensions  [PDF].    ·    ArcReader  is a free, easy-to-use desktop mapping application that allows users to view, explore, and print maps and globes.    - www.esri.com             Access:  ArcGIS is accessible on the Data Services workstations (located within the Research Commons on the 5th floor of Bobst Library). It should also be available on Windows workstations in STS managed Computer Labs ( http://www.nyu.edu/its/labs ) as well as on  NYU's VCL  . Personal academic copies are freely available to all NYU faculty, students and staff. To request a personal copy of ArcGIS please fill out the  ArcGIS request/renewal form  , and to request assistance using ArcGIS please fill out the Data Services  appointment form  or send an email to  data.services@nyu.edu . Please also refer to the  system requirements  for installing the personal academic copy of ArcGIS Desktop.           Google Earth:        It is available in three different verions. Data Services supports Google Earth (Free) and Google Earth Pro.       Google Earth   (Free) : Google Earth lets you fly anywhere to view satellite imagery, maps, terrain, 3D buildings, galaxies in outer space , and the depths of the ocean.        Google Earth Pro   (NOW available on reservable * workstations in the Data Services lab) :     Google Earth Pro is an advanced professional version of Google Earth free version. It has advanced features for Analysis, Visualization, Sharing and Data as well as better technical support from the vendor.      - www.earth.google.com      Access:   Google Earth is accessible on the Data Services lab workstations (located within the Research Commons on the 5th floor of Bobst Library). It should also be available on Windows workstations in STS managed Computer Labs (http://www.nyu.edu/its/labs). A free copy can be downloaded from http://www.earth.google.com .        * Google Earth Pro is accessible on the reservable * workstations (Data 16, 17, 18 & 19) in the Data Services lab workstations (located within the Research Commons on the 5th floor of Bobst Library).               ERDAS Imagine   : A geospatial image processing and analysis, and remote sensing GIS tool.         Access: **   ERDAS Imagine is accessible on the Data Services lab workstations but there is a restriction* on the number of users who may use the software concurrently.             SketchUp:        SketchUp is 3-D modelling program, and also works with Google Earth products. It is available in two versions - SketchUp (Free) and SketchUp Pro (coming soon to the Data Services lab). *Data Services provides access but does not actively support this software.       SketchUp  (Free) : SketchUp lets you build models of anything you can imagine - furniture, buildings, cities..       SketchUp Pro  (coming soon to the Data Services lab) : SketchUp Pro is 3D modeling software for professionals. You can create 3D models, either by starting from scratch or by using existing data. Import drawings, CAD plans, photos, aerial imagery and other information, then use the modeling tools in SketchUp Pro to develop your ideas into 3D. It also includes LayOut, which is the 2D companion to SketchUp Pro for creating deliverables like permit and construction drawings, presentation documents and full-screen digital presentations...   - www.sketchup.com       Access:   Google SketchUp is accessible on the Data Services lab workstations (located within the Research Commons on the 5th floor of Bobst Library). It should also be available on Windows workstations in STS managed Computer Labs (http://www.nyu.edu/its/labs). Free copy can be downloaded from http://www.sketchup.com.           Social Explorer:        Social Explorer is an online research tool designed to provide quick and easy access to current and historical census data and demographic information. The easy-to-use web interface lets users create maps and reports to better illustrate, analyze and understand demography and social change.    - www.socialexplorer.com       Access:   Premium access to Social Explorer is available through NYU Libraries .             GeoLytics:        GeoLytics gives users instant access to US Census data from 1970, 1980, 1990 and 2000 at the census tract level and other geographies such as population, household, and housing characteristics, income, poverty status, education level, employment, housing costs, immigration, and other variables...   - www.geolytics.com       Access:   Premium access to GeoLytics is available through  NYU Libraries  .            Other GIS Software:       There are many GIS software packages available other than the ones supported at DSS. A well-maintained  list of GIS software  can be found on Wikipedia.                                                      close                                                                                                          Spatial Data Resources                                                                                                                Spatial Data Repository                                                                                  Accessing Spatial Data                      Sign in with your NYU Net-ID and password to browse NYU hosted Spatial Data    There are two ways to access data from the Spatial Data Repository:   Option-1:    Download zip-files via web        Download the data directly by clicking on the download links found this webpage. The .shp files will be downloaded as a .zip file.      Option-2:    Database Connection via ArcGIS Software        Access the data directly using ArcGIS software (ArcCatalog/ArcMap). This option does NOT require download. For more information on setting up your computer to access the Spatial Data Repository please email us at  data.service@nyu.edu or fill out the Data Services appointment form .                                                General Information                         Location   Bobst Library 5th Floor, Research Commons 70 Washington Square South New York, NY 10012        Staffed Hours (Spring 2015)                 Mondays:   12pm - 8pm       Tuesdays:   12pm - 6pm       Wednesdays:   12pm - 8pm       Thursdays:   12pm - 6pm       Fridays:   12pm - 6pm           Data Services workstations are available for walk-in use whenever the library stacks are open .          Contact Us     Get help via our Request Form    Email us: data.services@nyu.edu    Call: (212) 998-3434                                             Spatial Data Repository                                                                            close                                                                                                          Public Spatial Data Sources                                                                                  General Information                         Location   Bobst Library 5th Floor, Research Commons 70 Washington Square South New York, NY 10012        Staffed Hours (Spring 2015)                 Mondays:   12pm - 8pm       Tuesdays:   12pm - 6pm       Wednesdays:   12pm - 8pm       Thursdays:   12pm - 6pm       Fridays:   12pm - 6pm           Data Services workstations are available for walk-in use whenever the library stacks are open .          Contact Us     Get help via our Request Form    Email us: data.services@nyu.edu    Call: (212) 998-3434                                             NYC & Metro Area Spatial Data                  NYC Information Technology & Telecommunications Building footprints, street centerlines, pavement edge, hydrography, open space, railroad lines, roadbed, shoreline, elevation. Bytes of the Big Apple New York City zoning features, boundaries, political and administrative districts, and PLUTO parcel data. New York State GIS Clearinghouse Data for the entire state of New York organized by the agency that created the data or holds the data. New Jersey GIS Network Search for and download New Jersey GIS data. CUGIR: Cornell University Geospatial Information Repository CUGIR provides geospatial data and metadata for New York State, with special emphasis on those natural features relevant to agriculture, ecology, natural resources, and human-environment interactions.                                              United States Spatial Data                  CrimeStat A spatial statistics program for the analysis of crime incident locations. GeoData.gov A portal for finding US maps and data from various US government websites. Tiger Files Basic street and boundary files for the entire United States. American FactFinder US Census and American Community Survey data downloadable as .xls or .dbf files to be joined to GIS shapefiles of Census geographies. GeoLytics Download Census data attached to shapefiles from 1970 to 2000. NYU login required; works best in Internet Explorer. US Geological Survey (USGS) Areas, digital raster graphics, DEM elevation data, roads, and more. National Historical Geographic Information System The NHGIS provides free access to aggregate Census data and GIS-compatible boundary files for the United States from 1790-2010.                                              World Spatial Data                  GIS Data Depot GIS Data Depot redistributes publicly available data. Data is organized by nation, state, and county. Map Library The Map Library is a source of public domain basic map data concerning administrative boundaries in developing countries. The data is broken down into manageable chunks to make it easier to download for those with poor internet connections. OpenStreetMap A free editable map of the whole world that allows users to view, edit, and use geographical data in a collaborative way from anywhere on Earth.                                                   close                                                                                                          Subscription/Membership Data (NYU Only)                                                                                  General Information                         Location   Bobst Library 5th Floor, Research Commons 70 Washington Square South New York, NY 10012        Staffed Hours (Spring 2015)                 Mondays:   12pm - 8pm       Tuesdays:   12pm - 6pm       Wednesdays:   12pm - 8pm       Thursdays:   12pm - 6pm       Fridays:   12pm - 6pm           Data Services workstations are available for walk-in use whenever the library stacks are open .          Contact Us     Get help via our Request Form    Email us: data.services@nyu.edu    Call: (212) 998-3434                                             Discipline-Specific Research Guides on Finding Maps                 Many of our other NYU Research Guides contain sections on finding maps!    Africana Studies: Digital Maps  Ancient Israel: Atlases, Maps  European Studies: Atlases  New York City: Maps  Primary Sources: Maps  Slavic Studies: Maps  South Asian Studies: Data & Maps  U.S. History: Maps            Comments (0)                                         Subscription/Membership Spatial Data (NYU Only)                      NYU subscribes to many premium databases and is member of various data repositories, clearing houses and consortia. Most of these resources are available to NYU patrons.      ·    NYS GIS Clearinghouse     The Clearinghouse, operated by the New York State Office of Cyber Security, was established to disseminate information about New York's Statewide GIS Coordination Program and to provide access to the New York State GIS Data and Metadata Repository . GIS users can browse the list, or search for specific keywords, to find out what data is available, who holds it, and how it can be obtained. In some cases, users will be able to go one step further, and download the actual data set.       Access Spatial Data:  To request an access to NYS GIS Clearinghouse, please fill out the Data Services  appointment form  or send a request to  data.services@nyu.edu  .           ·    Social Explorer     Social Explorer is an online research tool designed to provide quick and easy access to current and historical census data and demographic information. The easy-to-use web interface lets users create maps and reports to better illustrate, analyze and understand demography and social change.      Access Spatial Data:  Premium access to Social Explorer is available through NYU Libraries    .         ·    SimplyMap       SimplyMap is a web-based mapping application with access to thousands of demographic, business, and marketing data variables that can be used to develop interactive thematic maps and export high-resolution images to word processing or presentation software.       Access Spatial Data:  Premium access to SimplyMap is available through NYU Libraries  . Individual registrations are required.            ·    GeoLytics     GeoLytics gives users instant access to US Census data from 1970, 1980, 1990 and 2000 at the census tract level and other geographies such as population, household, and housing characteristics, income, poverty status, education level, employment, housing costs, immigration, and other variables...      Access Spatial Data:  Premium access to GeoLytics is available through NYU Libraries via  Bobcat  .          ·    Digital Sanborn Maps, 1867-1970       Digital Sanborn Maps provides access to more than 660,000 large-scale maps of more than 12,000 American towns and cities.       Access Spatial Data:  Access to the New York state Digital Sanborn Maps is available through NYU Libraries   . Only available to registered users.                                              Map Databases                  Map as History A collection of over 200 animated maps that are focused on topics and movements in history. China Geo-Explorer II China Geo-Explorer is an intelligence spatial data service offered by the University of Michigan China Data Center, in collaboration with the All China Market Research Co., Ltd and the State Key Laboratory for Information Engineering in Surveying, Mapping and Remote Sensing (LIESMARS) of Wuhan University. It offers China demographic and economic data, maps, charts and reports in the web-based delivery system. With this spatial intelligence, users are able to make rapid, accurate spatial decisions with greater confidence for regional planning, business investment, population, housing, environmental assessment, public health and many other spatial applications. Data sources in this database includes demographic and business information for all PRC geographies, including 31 Provinces, 345 Prefecture Cities, 2,873 Counties, and over 50,000 Townships. East View LandScan Global 2012 WebApp Access The LandScan Global Population Database, developed at the Department of Energy's Oak Ridge National Laboratory, is a global population database that shows geographical distribution of population at one-kilometer resolution over an average 24 hour period. Data can be downloaded for further analysis with GIS software.                                              Data Resources                  Data-Planet Data-Planet is a web-based tool that provides fast and easy access to data from licensed and public domain datasets within an easy to use interface. Scan the contents of the collection, select subjects and variables of interest, and view your data in side-by-side tables, charts, and maps. Reference USA Directory of more than 14 million US businesses compiled from the classified pages of telephone books; annual reports; federal, state and municipal data; and leading business magazines, trade publications and newspapers.                                                   close                                                                            General Information                         Location   Bobst Library 5th Floor, Research Commons 70 Washington Square South New York, NY 10012        Staffed Hours (Spring 2015)                 Mondays:   12pm - 8pm       Tuesdays:   12pm - 6pm       Wednesdays:   12pm - 8pm       Thursdays:   12pm - 6pm       Fridays:   12pm - 6pm           Data Services workstations are available for walk-in use whenever the library stacks are open .          Contact Us     Get help via our Request Form    Email us: data.services@nyu.edu    Call: (212) 998-3434                                             Spatial Data Resources                      Spatial Data Resources:       NYU Data Services provides access to a number of spatial data resources.       ·    NYU Spatial Data Repository  - NYU hosted spatial data    Browse and access a wide variety of ESRI datasets (US Census, streets, world geographies and more..) and some publicly available datasets.      Access Spatial Data:   You can access spatial data from the Spatial Data Repository by two methods:        Option-1:  Download zip-files via web         Download the data directly by clicking on the download links found under Spatial Data Repository  page. The .shp file/s will be downloaded as a .zip file.       Option-2:  Database Connection via ArcGIS Software         Access the data directly using ArcGIS software (ArcCatalog/ArcMap). This option does NOT require download. For more information on setting up your computer to access the Spatial Data Repository please email us at  data.service@nyu.edu or fill out the Data Services appointment form .            ·    Links to Public Spatial Data Resources  - externally hosted spatial data   NYU maintains a growing list of publicly available spatial data resources.       Access Spatial Data:   Most of these resources are free and can be directly accessed from vendors’ website.            ·    NYU Subscription/Membership Spatial Data     NYU subscribes to many premium databases and is member of various data repositories, clearing houses and consortia. Most of these resources are available to NYU patrons.       Access Spatial Data:   Most of these resources are freely available to NYU Patrons via  BobCat  . Download and access via ESRI ArcGIS software may require authentication with an NYU NetID and password. Go there now .                               close                                                                                                          GLOB-GC 1000 Post-Cold War                                                                                  Overview of GIS and Post-Cold War Studies                 Mapping and GIS analysis can be a key component in studying post-Cold War international relations. The resources in this guide are designed to help you discover data and design maps. Our class will work through the following tasks:     Find Information about   Locate Data Sources for Mapping Projects   Connect with GIS Tools   Practice work with Google Fusion Tables       Sample Documents   Data of Unemployment in post-Cold War European Union   European Union Country Boundaries                                             Scholarship and Information                 Use these databases to find scholarship about international relations in the post-Cold War era.  International Security & Counter-Terrorism Reference Center (ISCTRC) This database full-text coverage of journals and reports such as Stratfor Analysis, Stratfor Forecasts and Stratfor Geopolitical Diary, books, summaries and blogs. Academic Search Complete (EBSCO) An interdisciplinary source for thousands of journals. Academic Source Complete, designed specifically for academic institutions, is a multi-disciplinary full-text database, with more than 7,900 full-text periodicals, including more than 6,800 peer-reviewed journals. In addition to full text, this database offers indexing and abstracts for more than 11,900 journals and a total of more than 12,600 publications including monographs, reports, conference proceedings, etc. This scholarly collection offers full text coverage of information in many areas of academic study including: animal science, anthropology, area studies, astronomy, biology, chemistry, civil engineering, electrical engineering, ethnic & multicultural studies, food science & technology, general science, geography, geology, law, materials science, mathematics, mechanical engineering, music, pharmaceutical sciences, physics, psychology, religion & theology, veterinary science, women's studies, zoology, and many other fields. The database features PDF content going back as far as 1887, with the majority of full text titles in native (searchable) PDF format. CIAO The most comprehensive source for theory and research in international affairs. Includes working papers from university research institutes, occasional papers series from NGOs, foundation-funded research projects, proceedings from conferences, books, journals, and policy briefs. JSTOR Provides access to an archive of important scholarly journals, primarily in the humanities and social sciences, including 96 titles related to Political Science.                                              Data Sources for Post-Cold War Studies                 Use these data sources to find tabular data about political risk, economic well-being, and other indicators related to international policy.  Center for International Development and Conflict Management (U. of Maryland) - Peace and Conflict A biennial report that forecasts the future risks of political and social instability, as well as report trends and patterns in conflict, democratization, and terrorism. Integrated Network for Societal Conflict Research (INSCR) Armed Conflict Datasets This dataset is created to coordinate and integrate information resources produced and used by the Center for Systemic Peace. Global Peace Index A project by the Institute for Economics and Peace comprised of 23 indicators, ranging from a nation's level of military expenditure to its relations with neighbouring countries and level of respect for human rights. Uppsala Conflict Data Program The Uppsala Conflict Data Program (UCDP) has recorded ongoing violent conflicts since the 1970s. The data is becoming a standard in how conflicts are systematically defined and studied. ICPSR (U of Michigan) ICPSR advances and expands social and behavioral research, acting as a global leader in data stewardship and providing rich data resources and responsive educational opportunities for present and future generations. National Institute for Defense Studies NIDS is the leading research institution in Japan dedicated to the research on defense and national security issues. NYU Virtual Business Library - Country Information NYU's portal for data sources pertaining to political economy and social risk for countries around the world. Data-Planet Statistical data-sets for the United State and international countries.                                              Spatial Data Resources                 Consult with these sources to find spatial data, which you can use to create maps  World Boundaries - Fusion Table If you want to work with Google Fusion Tables, you can use pre-formed tables to join with data that you find from other sources. UCDP GED Data Download Hundreds of spatial data sets pertaining to international policy China Geo-Explorer II Data-sets and spatial data files for China. NYU Spatial Data Repository A Collection of spatial data files at NYU. Harvard University Geospatial Library The Open Geoportal library at Harvard allows you to find spatial data sets and download Shapefiles for geographic areas all over the world.
